Articles.Content: Could you explain how you get that Yamato to actually land on water, because to me it seems to have too little lift to be able to not just smash to pieces on contact with water

Could you explain how you get that Yamato to actually land on water, because to me it seems to have too little lift to be able to not just smash to pieces on contact with water

I actually used to cheat using the gratispa part to slowly land, but the last time I flew that thing I added VTOL engines under the hull to slowly lower itself into the water.
Added the Cougar and Wildcat! Maybe I\'ll get in the Panther tonight, which is the larger medium class of the light Wildcat.
Added the Panther.
Everything you make has suddenly became really small.

Everything you make has suddenly became really small.

I\'m starting to realize that size isn\'t everything anymore. Don\'t lie, the look much better than my old fighters!

But the Phoenix may come back to be a huge-ass bomber.

EDIT: Just remade the Phoenix bomber as the original (in the history page), and it flies like a dream #.#

Maybe I should hold a vote for a gen3 remake. What do you guys think?

EDIT: Poll.

30 minutes remaining in the poll.

So far, the results are:

1 - No

4 - Yes

3 - Waste your time on other stuff
VOTE JES PLEAZE
Needs moar war blimps!
Nope needs MOAR PONY SHAPED BATTLECRUISERS

Needs moar war blimps!

I tried making a decent hull but it required too many of those rectangle wing parts. Someone needs to make a 2x version of the C7 parts pack.
Voting over: The remake option wins 6-1

Nope needs MOAR PONY SHAPED BATTLECRUISERS

Now this guy; this guy I like.

Now this guy; this guy I like.

I need to ready the sniper.

OK really sorry I\'m a noob here but what I\'ve seen here looks very interesting! I\'ve seen corps mentioned and orders and that kinda stuff. Can somebody explain to me what this is all about? It is clearly a game that I am unawear of...and would certainly like to know more about/be part of! Kerbal wars sounds ultra-cool!

OK really sorry I\'m a noob here but what I\'ve seen here looks very interesting! I\'ve seen corps mentioned and orders and that kinda stuff. Can somebody explain to me what this is all about? It is clearly a game that I am unawear of...and would certainly like to know more about/be part of! Kerbal wars sounds ultra-cool!

It\'s nothing technical involving money. It\'s just a fun process of someone looking for a plane, and the engineer makes it for your to the specifications. Kerbal wars don\'t exist against eachother in-game since multiplayer doesn\'t exist. There is a KSP RP forum however, but it really has nothing to do with plane making anymore.
;D Still sounds cool though! I\'ll keep you in mind 42!
The new version of the Phoenix is having some technical difficulties. No matter how many struts are attached, when I start to accelerate on the landing strip all of the wings literally slide off.
Hmm is this still active Tim?

It will be active again sooner or later, but right now I'm really eager about the planets in the new update. I'm testing all kinds of rockets and mission types to plan for a few landings.

Why, what plane do you want me to make?

EDIT: Woowww... the new forum took a mighty dump on my OP...

Edited August 10, 2012 by Tim_Barrett
Hmm, How bout a Mach 12 Fighter... Stock Plus Devestator Railgun

Mach 12? As in speed?

...at what altitude?
2000 meters... A real challenge even for you, Ive got to mach 10, not 12 though. Also All jet engines and SRB's Small fighter please, Lag to much, dont wanna play a slide show...

That's over 4000m/s... if I can pull this off, it will be one ugly sucker. Bare bones too, no weapons.

And can SRB's be used?
\Actually lets have a contest, see who can get faster at 2000 meters, Mach 12 is the target, Sound fun.
